intro: Asemeia ilheotica, commonly known as the Ilheus starflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
